channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads
channel.description:
We need more server boards.
A show-off board would allow users to show-off a specific feature they have added that is either unique or hard to do.
An informative thread section would contain threads about rs protocol or anything that is informative or descriptive, but not tutorials. An informative section is for learning and sharing knowledge.
What do you think?

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:525087”]‘Show off’ = server development
‘Informative threads’ = server tutorials[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I read just fine

int interfaceId =

Of course the buffer has to read shorts/bytes/etc because that is how the protocol was written.

I was talking about the actual variables themselves, such as int interfaceId = getShortFromBuffer

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

hi my name is atomicint and i can’t read

[code]package org.apollo.net.release.r377;

import org.apollo.game.event.impl.ButtonEvent;
import org.apollo.net.codec.game.DataType;
import org.apollo.net.codec.game.GamePacket;
import org.apollo.net.codec.game.GamePacketReader;
import org.apollo.net.release.EventDecoder;

/**

  • An {@link EventDecoder} for the {@link ButtonEvent}.

  • @author Graham
    */
    public final class ButtonEventDecoder extends EventDecoder {

    @Override
    public ButtonEvent decode(GamePacket packet) {
    GamePacketReader reader = new GamePacketReader(packet);
    int interfaceId = (int) reader.getUnsigned(DataType.SHORT); // oh look a short
    return new ButtonEvent(interfaceId);
    }

}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Fire capez, post:32, topic:525087”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=643779.msg4333974#msg4333974 date=1374061338]
No they do not.
[/quote]

are u going to download one of the sources or wut[/quote]

I have, want to provide me with an example? I do not see the correct usage anywhere.

[quote=“Arcik, post:31, topic:525087”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=643779.msg4333754#msg4333754 date=1374023184]

what do primitive data types have to do with content

ever heard of packets

no shit, but who has ever associated the proper data type per packet? no one because casting is ugly as hell and it would be easier for everyone else to just use an integer.
[/quote]

you’re suppose to associate the proper data type[/quote]

tell me when anyone has done that within a released server, provide proof.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Two new server boards - Show-off and Informative Threads
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:18, topic:525087”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=643779.msg4333335#msg4333335 date=1373973493]

^ true

I find it funny everything is just calling pi shit when in reality EVERY source out there is shit considering it’s decent before content is added and afterwards…

yeah if the content is being written by someone shit it is

writing good content doesnt make the base good either
[/quote]somebody who writes bad content obviously can’t develop a good base either ( I know I can’t lol, and I’m pretty sure for the most part nobody here can…guru badge or not.)[/quote]

There are many good bases available (Apollo, Hyperion) that are not based on winterlove and are actually composed by people that know what they’re doing, a ‘base’ is merely a starting point for further progression so whether someone can write good content has no reflection on whether or not the base itself is good. People who write shit content will make the base shit, people who write good content will continue the legacy of a well written base.

Read full topic

Ambokile:

I’d say that Informative Threads fits more into General Server Discussion…
